reviews.review: This movie is basically the Bible
Fantastic, the animation works vividly with the voices, and the story is just fun!!
It was cute. Not too serious, great crowd. Would see again
the worst thing ever to grace the film network
This is an amazing movie, perfect

A modern masterpiece. I took my whole family to see it. My two kids loved it, and me and my wife did as well. I think my wife had shed a tear near the end. Beautiful. Buying the DVD as soon as it comes out.

It's as bad as people say it is. The slick animation hides underneath a cold dead film, a Frankenstein's monster crafted by lazy film executives to capitalize on a marketing buzzword. The script is so bland it feels like something a film student wrote for an assignment (and proceeded to get a D on). It's pretty clear this was just some generic script they pulled out of a pile, changed a few specific details and character names to fit the aquired brand name and sent off to the animation department. This is the definition of lazy machine film making. No one involved in this project put in any effort aside from the voice actors, but they can't save this lifeless corporate product. It also doesn't help that the film is filled with licensed pop music from a few years ago (almost like this film was planned half a decade ago and is just getting squeezed out now). Honestly the worst thing about this movie is that it got made instead of that really good looking Popeye movie by genndy tartakovsky (which now won't likely come out since tartakovsky dropped out of the project). All in all it's a shit movie made by shit people for lazy audiences too dimwitted to care that they're watching trash. Take your kid to see Spider-Man again or go to an amusement park or something.

I wasn't expecting much. But throw Anthony Leondis's "The Emoji Movie" in there with "Transformers 5" & "Valerian" for Worst Picture this year at the Razzies. *Paid for by Instagram, Spotify, & Dropbox* 

Boasting a lot of talent and money - Anthony Leondis, Eric Siegel, & Mike White clearly were looking to make an easy buck banking on the hard work of WB Animations "Legoverse" with an attempt at emotional depth by ripping plot threads from Disney's "Inside Out" with a splash of "Wreck It Ralph" and it shows. 

An atrociously stupid plot that I wouldn't want my children to watch for fear of severely lowering their standards and vocal performances that have the distinct sounds of the performers cashing checks all come together for this knock-off style animated mess.   

To put it simply, this is the "Sinister Squad" (2016) to the "Suicide Squad" (2016).
The sex scene was amazing. Let's just say the eggplant emoji was not "meh"!
